ratings.comment: 547 was a great class. Tons of info, but all very interesting. Focused very heavily on synthesis, which got a bit boring at times. I've never worked harder for a class than I did for 605. Weekly problem sets, lots of take home quizzes, a few exams. Very time consuming, but it was one of my favorite classes I've taken. Hans is an amazing professor.

Hans is by far the most intelligent person I have met. He cares about the subjects and students he teaches with a passion. During his courses I feel as though I have broken barriers and actually have become smarter, as well as better at all of my courses. His tests are very difficult, but they are extremely fair.

Has been teaching for 40 years, so it's all old hat for him.  Can go too fast at times so reading ahead of time helps.  Always copy your notes after lecture and ask questions.  Always has exam questions about ranking reactivity/acidity/etc. of different compounds.  Tests are fair, and he definitely knows his stuff.  Great guy as well.

Brilliant man, but he didn't explain things completely and would often draw arrows with "chemistry" written above them to finish a mechanism. He didn't really connect the class material and the tests were nothing like he covered in class. Also had to pay to do online homework which was only somewhat helpful.

If you like O-chem, you should definitely take all of Prof. Reich's classes. (Yes, we did, though the class number only says 605). Seriously, he is most incredible and intelligent professor we have ever had, and "students" are his No.1 priority. He made extra time for us, and he has been extremely helpful in every question we've asked so far.

Professor Reich is hands down the most incredible professor in the chemistry department.  His class is definitely challenging, but if you review his notes and go to his office hours and group discussions you will walk out extremely satisfied.

Extremely intelligent man (he has 152 publications, 2 computer programs, and 9 websites) teaching a very challenging course, but with a certain grace and clarity that makes going to class quite enjoyable. Highly recommended.

Hans is the most brilliant professor I have ever talked with.  His knowledge of organic chemistry is incomprehensible yet he is a great teacher and willing to answer any and all questions. Exams are very hard but with a fair curve.  This has been the best college course I have taken.  Highly recommended.

Guy knows how to teach. Very approachable. Take home quiz every week but not too difficult. MUCH better professor than his wife. Makes class enjoyable because he is so energetic about OCHEM. Its not the easiest class ever...but then again it is OCHEM. If possible take his class - worth it. B is easily in reach.

Firstly, all orgo requires memorization.  I will not bust his balls on that.  Aside from that, in comparison to other orgo lecturers (ie. his wife) he is by far the easiest.  He covers everything in depth and as long as you study, you're fine.  Do whatever it takes to have him as your orgo professor!
The most intellectually-challenging - but also the most hard core and informative - organic chemist you will ever see throughout your undergraduate studies. Period.
Class was extremely informative and interesting.  Exams were very difficult (as is Reich's style).  Exams required an equal amount of memorization and chemical understanding.

"Hans is a smart guy." I heard that a lot in conversation about Prof. Reich, and it's oh so true. This man is incredible, and a very good teacher. The class is fast paced and difficult, but you'll learn a lot!
